summary.para: Retrieves a pointer to the object representing the entire property frame dialog box that contains all the pages. Calling this method could potentially allow one page to navigate to another.
However, there are no container interfaces defined for this role, so this method always fails in the property frame implementation.

param.name: ppUnk
param.para: A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the container object. If an error occurs, the implementation must set *ppUnk to NULL.

summary.para: Provides the main features for a property page site object.

remarks.para: For each property page created within a property frame, the frame creates a property page site to provide information to the property page and to receive notifications from the page when changes occur. This latter notification is used to initiate a call to , the return value of which is then used to enable or disable the frame's Apply button.

The system provides an implementation of the IPropertyPageSite interface through the or functions. The frame implementation provided through these functions only implements the and methods. The and methods return E_NOTIMPL.
